name: Scones
description: Scrumptious savory snack great to have on a lazy Sunday afternoon.
keywords: Scones, Baking, SnackCreamy, Jam, Savory, Dense, Dessert, Afternoon Tea, Quick Baking, Homemade, Easy Recipe, Lazy Sunday, Teatime, British, Traditional, Pastry, Buttery, Simple, Flaky, Butter Biscuits, Classic Recipe

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 200Â°C. Prep 2 trays with baking paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep oven

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl mush the butter into the flower by hand until it starts to resemble breadcrumbs.
recipeInstructions.name: Mush butter

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the milk into the butter/flour mix until a dough forms.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix in milk

recipeInstructions.text: Knead dough a few times but don't over mix, adding more milk or flour if it's too dry or wet.
recipeInstructions.name: Knead

recipeInstructions.text: Roll dough out to about 1-2cm thick. Using a cookie cutter, cut discs out of the dough and put them onto the trays. You should be able to produce roughly 12 scones with some leftover dough which is still fine to cook.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll out and cut dough

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for roughly 20-25 minutes or until browning on the outside.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake

recipeInstructions.text: Serve warm with cream and jam.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

notes: Very important not to over mix to get the right texture.
Important to cut out the scones so that you get the right look, otherwise if you try and shape the dough you end up with little blobs.
